item.title: Bellingham - the England hero who 'writes his own scripts'
item.description: Jude Bellingham's remarkable rise continued as he netted England's winner in their Euro 2024 opener against Serbia.

item.title: Peace talks tomorrow if Russia leaves Ukraine, Zelensky says
item.description: The remarks come as Ukraine's president hails international support at a summit in Switzerland.

item.title: Police driver who hit escaped cow with car removed from duty
item.description: A farmer whose runaway cow was rammed by police says the footage of the incident is a sorry sight.

item.title: Reform UK candidate resigns over 'unacceptable' blog posts
item.description: Grant StClair-Armstrong says he will still contest the election and serve as an independent if elected.

item.title: DeChambeau wins US Open after McIlroy falters in run-in
item.description: American Bryson DeChambeau wins his second US Open title after Rory McIlroy collapses with three bogeys in final four holes.

item.title: More people turning away from news, report says
item.description: News avoidance is now at record high levels, the Reuters Institute's 2024 Digital News Report says.

item.title: At least 14 Hajj pilgrims die in intense heat
item.description: Jordan's foreign ministry said its nationals had died "after suffering sun stroke due to the extreme heatwave".

item.title: Alarm in Hamburg as man with axe shot by police
item.description: The man, who police say made threats with a pickaxe and an "incendiary device", was seriously injured.

item.title: Whoever becomes PM will find the foreign stage a crowded one
item.description: For all the focus on domestic issues, there will be plenty for whoever becomes PM to focus on abroad

item.title: Murray says retiring at Wimbledon or Olympics 'would be fitting'
item.description: Andy Murray says he would prefer to retire at Wimbledon or the Paris Olympics as his tennis career draws towards an end.

item.title: Military ‘pause’ on Gaza road inflames divisions in Israeli government
item.description: The announcement of a "local, tactical pause" in fighting triggered a furious response from far-right ministers.

item.title: Boat crew 'thrilled' by playful dolphins
item.description: Volunteers from Hoylake RNLI say it was a treat to see the pod of dolphins riding the waves.

item.title: Reform's rise: Polling guru John Curtice on this week's figures
item.description: John Curtice examines the latest opinion polls ahead of the 4 July general election.

item.title: Ed Davey says stunts are to showcase policies
item.description: The Lib Dem leader defends his party's tactics for getting its manifesto ideas across to the public.

item.title: Electioncast: A National Health (Service) Check
item.description: A look at health and social care policies after warnings over ambitions.

item.title: What does Nigel Farage really want?
item.description: Why is a man who has failed to get elected to Parliament seven times causing panic in Tory ranks?

item.title: How do I register to vote?
item.description: Here’s what you need to know about how you register to vote and when.

item.title: Who can I vote for in the general election?
item.description: Find out which constituency you are in, who you can vote for and where you can vote using our postcode search.

item.title: Election poll tracker: How do the parties compare?
item.description: How do people say they will vote in the UK general election? Our poll tracker measures the trends.

item.title: As campaign passes halfway, mood in Tory and Labour camps could not be more different
item.description: Chris Mason and Henry Zeffman find Sunak supporters downbeat and Starmer's team buoyant as polls fail to narrow.

item.title: Migration, voter fraud and climate change – Farage's claims fact-checked
item.description: The Reform UK leader spoke to BBC Breakfast and Radio 5 Live about several issues on Friday morning.

item.title: Labour candidate Rosie Duffield cancels hustings
item.description: Ms Duffield has previously faced death threats and abuse over her stance on sex and gender.

item.title: Starmer: I'm prepared to make enemies on the economy
item.description: The Labour leader is grilled by the BBC's Nick Robinson on tax, growth, the NHS in a Panorama interview.

item.title: Chris Mason: What Farage poll boost means for the election
item.description: A single opinion poll shaped a day on the campaign trail - but Nigel Farage has had false dawns before.

item.title: Forbes sets out SNP's 'in-between' stance on oil and gas
item.description: On Question Time Kate Forbes said the party would take applications on a "case by case" basis.

item.title: Labour raises £350k more than Tories in first campaign week
item.description: The figures are a huge turnaround on the 2019 election, when the Tories attracted 87% of all donations.

item.title: Your Voice, Your Vote - Ros Atkins takes questions on tactical voting
item.description: Your Voice, Your Vote - The BBC answers your questions about tactical voting.

item.title: How I’m approaching my party leader interviews
item.description: The BBC’s Nick Robinson explains how he is approaching his interviews with party leaders ahead of the UK general election.

item.title: The papers: 'England's winning start' and Labour's job pledge
item.description: England's winning start at Euro 2024 and Labour's plan for 650,000 jobs lead Monday's newspapers.

item.title: Too much of a good thing? Spain's green energy can exceed demand
item.description: Spain is looking at storing electricity or increasing demand to solve electricity oversupply.

item.title: 'Hackers leaked intimate photos after my laptop was stolen'
item.description: A Spanish filmmaker turned the cameras on herself and made a "sextortion diary" after being blackmailed.

item.title: Avicii’s dad: 'I miss him every minute, but I get angry at him for leaving'
item.description: The DJ's father Klas on his son's legacy and family's mission to raise mental health awareness.

item.title: 'There were no warning signs before terminal diagnosis'
item.description: Mark Butcher said there were "zero symptoms" before his terminal diagnosis.

item.title: Susannah's grandad ran Bengal when famine killed millions
item.description: She is only just learning about Sir John Herbert's significant role in the catastrophe.

item.title: Warnings over Guatemala's volcano tourist hotspot
item.description: Scientists say tourists don't understand the dangers when they sign up for hiking trips.

item.title: 'A win is a win': England fans react to opening match
item.description: England fans celebrated England's win over Serbia, but are still unsure if the team can win the Euros.

item.title: England fans involved in incident before Serbia game
item.description: England fans were involved in "an altercation" with Serbia supporters before their teams' opening Euro 2024 match in Gelsenkirchen.

item.title: Highlights: England hold on for winning start against Serbia
item.description: Jude Bellingham's first half header secures victory for England in their opening Group C Uefa Euro 2024 match at the Arena AufSchalke.

item.title: Lions, cheese hats and a double-decker bus - joining the Dutch fan parade
item.description: Netherlands supporters turned the streets of Hamburg orange before their opening game against Poland - as they have done for decades.

item.title: Clarke had to 'kick backsides & give cuddles' after Germany loss
item.description: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke says he had to "kick a couple of backsides" and "give a couple of cuddles" after admitting some miscommunication contributed to their humbling defeat by Germany.

item.title: Euro 2024 off to exhilarating start as records tumble
item.description: A teenage star, broken records and goals galore - the European Championship has packed plenty into its first two days.

item.title: All you need to know about Euro 2024
item.description: Who has the toughest group? Where will the games be played? And who are favourites to win the tournament?

item.title: Uefa Euro 2024 TV schedule
item.description: Throughout Euro 2024 BBC Sport will update this page with your channel guide for each game.

item.title: 'A very, very special player' - Yamal, 16, makes Euros history
item.description: Spanish football expert Guillem Balague looks at Lamine Yamal's rise to becoming the youngest player in European Championship history.

item.title: BBC pundits pick their England teams
item.description: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer, Wayne Rooney and company pick their England team for Sunday's Euro 2024 game against Serbia.

item.title: Euro 2024: The nations' 26-man squads for Germany
item.description: All the final squads for Euro 2024 have now been named.

item.title: Which Premier League players are going to Euro 2024?
item.description: A look at the Premier League players selected to represent their countries at Euro 2024 in Germany this summer.

item.title: Are animals conscious? How new research is changing minds
item.description: A series of experiments have led a number of scientists to say animals may be conscious.

item.title: Jordan Bardella could soon be French PM at 28. But for many he remains an enigma
item.description: Jordan Bardella's rise has been meteoric after being spotted by Marine Le Pen

item.title: What does Nigel Farage really want?
item.description: Why is a man who has failed to get elected to Parliament seven times causing panic in Tory ranks?

item.title: Crime here is hurting, whatever the statistics say
item.description: In some areas, getting a grip on crime is a major election issue.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'on top of the world'
item.description: A selection of the photographs on a given theme.

item.title: Beijing offers pandas as ties with Australia thaw
item.description: During a visit to Adelaide Zoo, China's Premier Li Qiang gets into a bit of panda diplomacy.

item.title: 'We love you, Papa': George, Charlotte and Louis mark Father's Day
item.description: Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis post a Father's Day tribute to Prince William in their first social media post.

item.title: Historic writer's desk could be 'knackered' old fake
item.description: Is this piece of furniture really a literary relic, or part of a Victorian money-making hustle?

item.title: Bonnie Langford left breathless by Doctor Who star
item.description: Dancer and actress Bonnie Langford returned as Melanie Bush on Saturday.

item.title: Police seek driver who cost canal charity £100,000
item.description: The HGV driver failed to report hitting and damaging a 250-year-old canal bridge.

item.title: Muted Eid celebrations for millions of Nigerian Muslims
item.description: The economic crisis means millions of Nigerian Muslims will not be celebrating Eid al-Adha as normal.

item.title: DeChambeau wins US Open after McIlroy falters in run-in
item.description: American Bryson DeChambeau wins his second US Open title after Rory McIlroy collapses with three bogeys in final four holes.

item.title: Watch: McIlroy's collapse as DeChambeau wins US Open
item.description: Watch Rory McIlroy miss the chance to end a 10-year wait for a major title as Bryson DeChambeau claims his second US Open title in Pinehurst.

item.title: Pakistan beat Ireland to end disappointing campaign
item.description: Pakistan hold on to claim a nervy three-wicket win over Ireland as disappointing T20 World Cup campaigns for both sides come to an end.

item.title: Bellingham - the England hero who 'writes his own scripts'
item.description: Jude Bellingham's remarkable rise continued as he netted England's winner in their Euro 2024 opener against Serbia.

item.title: Boulter beats Raducanu and Pliskova to retain Nottingham title
item.description: Katie Boulter retains the Nottingham Open title after coming from a set down to beat Karolina Pliskova.

item.description: A look at health and social care policies after warnings over ambitions.

item.title: Celine Dion: 'How I've rebuilt my voice'
item.description: The singer talks about her comeback from a debilitating neurological illness.

item.title: There’s only one Michael Mosley
item.description: Michael’s last interview, How to Live a Good Life, with Prof Paul Bloom at Hay Festival.

item.title: Mbappé
item.description: From Paris suburbs to the pinnacle of football, a look at a once-in-a-generation talent.

item.title: Rooney 2004: World at His Feet
item.description: Wayne Rooney’s definitive coming-of-age story, told by the man himself.

item.title: Pep Guardiola: Chasing Perfection
item.description: How and why has Pep Guardiola been able to revolutionise football?

item.title: Copa ’71: The Lost Lionesses - Storyville
item.description: Story of an extraordinary tournament, told through the voices of the women who took part.

item.title: When will interest rates come down?
item.description: Bank of England interest rates affect mortgage, loan and savings rates for millions of people.

item.title: How quickly are prices rising in the UK?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising has fallen from record highs, but is still above the 2% target.

item.title: Five tips when asking for a pay rise
item.description: Recruiters, a manager and a workplace psychologist give their advice on how to negotiate for more money.

item.title: Who gets 15 hours of free childcare and how do I apply?
item.description: Parents in England can now access 15 hours of free weekly childcare for their two-year-olds.

item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.description: Given higher costs, some students are wondering whether going to university makes financial sense.

item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: How much is the state pension worth now?
item.description: Payments to pensioners have risen by 8.5% following the government's "triple lock" pledge.

item.description: More than 10m people out of work in the UK, so if you're searching for a job you're not alone. Here are some tips on how to get started.

item.description: Two National Insurance cuts came info effect in 2024, but many people are still paying more in tax.

item.title: Can my landlord put up my rent, keep my deposit or evict me?
item.description: UK renters have seen increases of 10% and two million are behind or struggling to pay.

item.description: People claiming universal credit and working under 18 hours a week will have to look for more work.

item.title: Three arrested as boy, 16, killed by falling tree
item.description: Two men have been arrested on suspicion of manslaughter, say Nottinghamshire Police.

item.title: 'Substantial' fish kill in River Roe
item.description: The Departure of Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs (DAERA) is investigating the incident.

item.title: Oil and gas still needed in net zero transition - Swinney
item.description: John Swinney refused to confirm whether the SNP would avoid adopting a 'presumption against' new north sea exploration.

item.title: Parties target protesting farmers in election pitch
item.description: Protests spread in the wake of a consultation over Welsh government payments to farmers.
